Container.Name: SyncLounge
Container.Overview: [B]What is SyncLounge?[/B][BR] SyncLounge allows you and your friends/family to watch Plex in sync, wherever you are.[BR] [BR] [B]Modified by me to always join your self-hosted server. Just set DOMAIN and don't remove AUTOJOIN![/B][BR] For this to work you need to pass [B]http://IP:2088/ptweb[/B] and [B]http://IP:2089/ptserver[/B] through to your [B]HTTPS-enabled[/B] reverse proxy running at DOMAIN. This works best with the nginx-letsencrypt docker.[BR] [BR] [B]How does it work?[/B][BR] 1. Log in to your Plex.tv account[BR] 2. Select your player (Plex Media Player, Apple TV, Nvidia Shield etc.)[BR] 3. Join a SyncLounge Room, or create your own[BR] 4. Give your friends/family your SL Room details[BR] 5. Enjoy your media, fully synchronised[BR]
Container.Description: [B]What is SyncLounge?[/B][BR] SyncLounge allows you and your friends/family to watch Plex in sync, wherever you are.[BR] [BR] [B]Modified by me to always join your self-hosted server. Just set DOMAIN and don't remove AUTOJOIN![/B][BR] For this to work you need to pass [B]http://IP:2088/ptweb[/B] and [B]http://IP:2089/ptserver[/B] through to your [B]HTTPS-enabled[/B] reverse proxy running at DOMAIN. This works best with the nginx-letsencrypt docker.[BR] [BR] [B]How does it work?[/B][BR] 1. Log in to your Plex.tv account[BR] 2. Select your player (Plex Media Player, Apple TV, Nvidia Shield etc.)[BR] 3. Join a SyncLounge Room, or create your own[BR] 4. Give your friends/family your SL Room details[BR] 5. Enjoy your media, fully synchronised[BR]
